page.title: 07CHURCH & CHAPEL IN PLYMTREE
page.content: The thriving Anglican Church is situated in the heart of the village. It was built in the 12th Century and has records dating back a long time. It has a square tower and inside a handsome painted rood-screen and an organ. There is a pulpit, font, stoup, and 6 bells in the tower. There is a Service every Sunday and also a Sunday School. The Priest in Charge is also responsible for the Parishes of Broad- hembury and Payhembury. The United Reform Chapel, built in the 19th Century, is situated at the other end of the village. It has a pulpit and lectern, an upstairs and a vestry. It is run by a group of Elders and a Minister in Charge who also has res- ponsibility for the Ottery St Mary Chapel. It has its own choir and well- attended Services are held on Sunday mornings & 1 monthly evening.
